data.onePageSummary: The iPhone 17 Pro Max introduces a bold redesign with an aluminum unibody and prominent camera plateau, available in striking Cosmic Orange. It features a 6.9-inch LTPO Super Retina XDR OLED display with 3000 nits peak brightness and improved anti-reflective coating. Powered by the A19 Pro chip with vapor chamber cooling, it delivers top-tier performance (AnTuTu 2,600,583; GeekBench 10,118 multicore) and better sustained thermals, though some heat issues persist. The triple 48MP camera system includes a new 4x telephoto lens with 8x optical-quality zoom, praised for photo quality but slightly behind Android rivals in low-light. Video capabilities remain class-leading. Battery life sees meaningful gains (17:58h active use), though charging remains slower than competitors (40W wired). iOS 26's Liquid Glass UI refreshes the experience but has minor bugs. Apple Intelligence lags behind Google/Samsung in functionality. Durability is enhanced with Ceramic Shield 2, but aluminum is prone to scratches. Priced from $1,199, it offers strong longevity with Apple's update policy.
pros: Excellent telephoto camera with 4x optical/8x sensor crop zoom (mentioned: GSMArena, TechRadar, Android Central)
Class-leading video recording capabilities including ProRes RAW (mentioned: The Verge, Tom's Guide, GSMArena)
Bright 3000-nit OLED display with anti-reflective coating (mentioned: DXOMark, PhoneArena, TechRadar)
Improved battery life and sustained performance via vapor chamber cooling (mentioned: GSMArena, The Verge, Android Authority)
Durable Ceramic Shield 2 protection and IP68 rating (mentioned: GSMArena, Tom's Guide)
cons: Apple Intelligence still limited vs competitors (mentioned: Android Authority, The Verge, Tom's Guide)
Charging speeds slower than Android flagships (mentioned: GSMArena, PhoneArena, TechRadar)
Aluminum body prone to scratches (mentioned: GSMArena, Android Central)
Occasional thermal throttling under heavy load (mentioned: Android Authority, Tom's Guide)
iOS 26 Liquid Glass UI has minor bugs and inconsistencies (mentioned: PhoneArena, The Verge)

Camera.explanation: DXOMark score: 151/200. GSMArena, TechRadar praise telephoto upgrade and video excellence. Low-light slightly behind Chinese rivals per TechRadar. Selfie Center Stage innovation noted by multiple sources. (real-time normalized: 9.15 → 7.87) (real-time normalized: 7.87 → 8.11)

Battery Endurance.explanation: GSMArena tested 17:58h active use. Improved capacity (4823/5088mAh) and efficiency praised by The Verge/Android Central. Charging limited to 40W wired (slower than Android peers). Degradation not mentioned. (real-time normalized: 8.42 → 8.62) (real-time normalized: 8.62 → 9.90)

Performance.explanation: A19 Pro dominates benchmarks (GeekBench 10,118 multi-core). Vapor chamber improves sustained performance per GSMArena/TechRadar. Minor throttling noted by Android Authority. (real-time normalized: 9.55 → 7.83)

Display.explanation: DXOMark score: 151/200. 3000-nit brightness and anti-glare coating praised by PhoneArena/GSMArena. Color accuracy and HDR support excellent across reviews. (real-time normalized: 9.30 → 9.86) (real-time normalized: 9.86 → 6.31) (real-time normalized: 6.31 → 8.00)

Software Experience.explanation: iOS 26 Liquid Glass UI modern but buggy per The Verge/PhoneArena. Strong update policy offsets limited AI features vs Google/Samsung. (real-time normalized: 8.10 → 9.80)

Design & Build.explanation: Aluminum unibody praised for grip but criticized for softness (GSMArena/Android Central). Cosmic Orange color widely liked. Haptics remain best-in-class. (real-time normalized: 8.65 → 9.86) (real-time normalized: 9.86 → 6.31) (real-time normalized: 6.31 → 8.00)

Longevity Value.explanation: Apple's industry-leading update policy (5+ years). High price justified for pros per TechRadar. Resale value remains strong. (real-time normalized: 9.20 → 9.80)
